entry.title: [ios] Make Video capture device orientation aware
entry.content:
A camera always captures pixels with an orientation of `landscapeLeft`.

This CL rotates the actual pixel data to match the device orientation.



Bug: 1430702

entry.title: [ios] Introduce DateTimeChooserIOS
entry.content:
This CL introduces DateTimeChooserIOS to handle the date time dialog

on iOS. If blink::mojom::DateTimeChooser is bound on iOS,

DateTimeChooserIOS manages the Mojo interfaces.



In a follow-up CL, it would create a UI dialog on iOS and manage

opening and closing the dialog on the iOS framework.



Bug: 1461947

entry.title: [iOS] Implement UIShutdownNoDismiss in UserSigninCoordinator
entry.content:
This patch implement correctly the case to interrupt

UserSigninCoordinator and AuthenticationFlow for

SigninCoordinatorInterrupt::UIShutdownNoDismiss.



For UIShutdownNoDismiss case, the UI doesn't need to be dismiss, but

sign-in completion block and the interrupt completion block need to be

called in that order and synchronously before the end of

-[SigninCoordinator interruptWithAction:completion:].



Related to crrev.com/c/4665648.



Fixed: 1455216

Bug: 1464582

Change-Id: Ie55dad68f98235307477b526ef25a02c029df034

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4667151

Commit-Queue: Jérôme Lebel

Reviewed-by: Arthur Milchior

Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

entry.title: [ios] Refactor settings code about UserSelectableType::kPayments
entry.content:
Starting with https://crrev.com/c/4660713, kPayments is also listed as

syncer::UserSelectableType, which unblocks simplifications in UI code.

Ideally kPayments should share most code with other user-selectable

types, modulo the special-casing required for the payments-autofill

coupling (until crbug.com/1435431 is tackled).



In this patch, as a first step, the code to construct

autocompleteWalletItem is refactored, to lean on the common

tableViewItemWithDataType() function.



Change-Id: Ie9f0b0d7781ceee46eeb8d851062c2b51915c2f8

entry.title: [iOS] Fix testAdvancedSettingsWithSyncPassphrase
entry.content:
testAdvancedSettingsWithSyncPassphrase flaks are in

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/first_run/first_run_egtest.mm;l=602;drc=d6f0474de0814bee9f92efb43d2a1cf936c16cdc



The issue is the tablecell that contains "Encryption" is:

"Cannot perform tap at {nan, nan} as it is outside window's bounds"



It seems that when searching for the table cell, it is found when

being outside of the window, therefore the scrollview is not used.



To solve the flake, "grey_sufficientlyVisible()" is added to the

matcher for the "Encryption" table view.



According to the 7 ios-simulator-noncq runs, it fixed the flaks for

this test.



Fixed: 1464973

Change-Id: Ieeebf039a956784267849d3835b39d84e5eed1d2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4689667

Auto-Submit: Jérôme Lebel

Reviewed-by: Menghan Yang

Commit-Queue: Menghan Yang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171674}

entry.title: Reland "[dpwa] Replaces 2 check actions CheckAppToolbar[Not]Visible with CheckWindowControlsOverlayToggleIcon."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 7eda64a5236a2e0dad4362a33ff6d9619086c1a5

The test is flaky on ChromeOS lacros run and so the action is disabled

on ChromeOS for now.



Original change's description:

> [dpwa] Replaces 2 check actions CheckAppToolbar[Not]Visible with

> CheckWindowControlsOverlayToggleIcon.

>

> The purpose of CheckAppToolbarVisible and CheckAppToolbarNotVisible is

> to determine if the WCO toggle button exists. But the implementation

> doesn't work for all platforms because the toolbar still exists on Mac

> even if the app window in fullscreen mode.

> Combined the 2 actions into 1 action. The new action checks if the

> toolbar exists first, if it exists, we will check if the toggle icon is

> there.

>

> Bug: b/288629264

> Change-Id: I3cc8beb45e5bb6b7b38ad9110356cd9fa9dd7629

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4682382

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

> Commit-Queue: Clifford Cheng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169970}

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Reset pointer flags after user move or resize operation
entry.content:
This fixes an issue where Chromium still believes that the left mouse

button is being held down after a window move operation.



This causes `CompoundEventFilter` to refuse to set the appropriate

cursors in the non-client area, leading to issues like

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1454893.



Bug: 1432559, 1454893

Change-Id: I6a13f8bedef331ddd09f84cfe7469c8342998f0d

entry.title: [ios] Support showing sign-in sheet from promo card
entry.content:
The support isn't used yet, so no behavior difference.

Before this CL, the promo card buttons only had 2 possible behaviors:

show the sync consent screen, or instantly sign-in. Now it also

supports showing the sign-in sheet. This will be needed for the

top-of-feed promo card and possibly for recent tabs (pending product

discussion).

entry.title: QuickStart: Use Base64UrlString type for challenge data
entry.content:
Use Base64UrlString instead of std::string as the data type of challenge

data to avoid encoding issues. std::string doesn't reveal the encoding

of the underlying data. This can lead to some fields storing raw bytes

while the expected storage was base64url encoded string.

entry.title: dlp: Add FileBackedBlobFactory interface and browser side
entry.content:
This CL adds a new interface to register file backed blobs.

For frames, this interface is in sync with navigation and thus

can be used to retrieve the URL from which blobs are accessed.

This will be used to perform data leak prevention checks for

managed users having specific file related policies.



This CL only adds the interface and its browser-side implementation.

For the actual usage see children CLs in the relation chain.



See also comments and discussions in the original big CL https://crrev.com/c/4249117/159, from which this one was extracted.



More info:

- design doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tiK7HcFivDIK288PlEtqxPWEhMy-A5FjPf0A8Gmx4g4/edit#bookmark=id.wbsjo0yog42m)

- slightly more detailed overview (http://docs/document/d/1FrYQYg7PqGmjbfsjjQx_AVcAW--KSyoYI-rL8fx-lu0?resourcekey=0-KJCn36cd-eFdWwIDhKuKuQ)



Bug: b/289974874

Test: out/Default/content_unittests --gtest_filter=FileBackedBlobFactoryImplTest.*

entry.title: [ProfileSelections] Transition extension keyed factories to use Profile Selections
entry.content:
Make sure that all extension factories (that do not use the

BrowserContextKeyedAPI) use the Profile Selection logic through the

ExtensionBrowserClient to have more control over different profile

types.

Mainly so that it stops being able to indirectly create services for the

System Profile and be able to easily control the creation for the Guest

Profile through the force variable.



Changes:

- `GetOriginalContext()` --> `GetContextRedirectedToOriginal()`

- `context` --> `GetContextOwnInstance()`

- no implementation --> `GetContextForOriginalOnly()`



These changes will indirectly cause those services not to be able to be

created for the System Profile, and the creation for the Guest Profile

will be dependant on the `force_guest_profile` variable.



Also added protections to some stacks in extensions to return early in

case of System Profile (Extensions are disabled in the System Profile).



Bug: 1284664

Change-Id: I1ca9a345ca769ef42cb17ae38516a399283c4fd2

entry.title: [mathml] Simplify NGMathPaddedLayoutAlgorithm::GatherChildren
entry.content:
Code coverage report indicates that OOF branch in GatherChildren is not

reached [1] even though it should be exercised by WPT test [2]. This is

because elements actually generates nodes that are

LayoutNGMathMLBlockWithAnonymousMrow, which in turn are either empty

or just contain an anonymous wrapper for 's children. Rename

the method GetContentAsAnonymousMrow to make this more explicit and

simplify it.



Bug: 1464154



[1] https://analysis.chromium.org/coverage/p/chromium/file?host=chromium.googlesource.com&project=chromium/src&ref=refs/heads/main&revision=c8a01d35ed430e49e8275f641f735e689a97c105&path=//third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/ng/mathml/ng_math_padded_layout_algorithm.cc&platform=linux&test_suite_type=any&modifier_id=0#53

[2] mathml/relations/css-styling/out-of-flow/all-mathml-containers.html



Change-Id: I356acef2f15b7b04afd269de280a78b582d2a78d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4684183

Commit-Queue: Frédéric Wang

entry.title: Reland "Reland "PreloadingDevTools: Disable prerendering for clients other than DevTools frontend""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4eec02d0bce9b3eaf43a13b77fa26b3bc77591fd.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Reland "PreloadingDevTools: Disable prerendering for clients other than DevTools frontend""

>

> This reverts commit b122b241a6953480e212d08bbe5cf943273b55c9.

>

> Reason for revert: still suspect for flakes in prerender.js; see https://crbug.com/1465610

>

> Original change's description:

> > Reland "PreloadingDevTools: Disable prerendering for clients other than DevTools frontend"

> >

> > This reverts commit 1d662ac2d1de7a911afab7420cb832b4b31284c9.

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > Revert "PreloadingDevTools: Disable prerendering for clients other than DevTools frontend"

> > >

> > > This reverts commit 9d392f330f25bce3f6fc8c2b0b927e02a7bd28c5.

> > >

> > > Reason for revert: Suspect for making

> > > http/tests/inspector-protocol/tracing/prerender.js flaky on Mac:

> > > https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac10.15%20Tests

> > > https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac10.15%20Tests/39245/overview

> > >

> > > Original change's description:

> > > > PreloadingDevTools: Disable prerendering for clients other than DevTools frontend

> > > >

> > > > Prerendering introduced switching of FrameTreeNodes in the browser side

> > > > and frame targets in the CDP client side. If a CDP client unaware of

> > > > this logic and a prerendered page activated, it will cause unexpected

> > > > behaviors. For example, Puppeteer loses control. To mitigate this, this

> > > > CL disables prerendering if a target without tab target support is

> > > > attached. For more details, see [1].

> > > >

> > > > [1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/12HVmFxYj5Jc-eJr5OmWsa2bqTJsbgGLKI6ZIyx0_wpA

> > > >

entry.title: [Office upload] Always use a Copy IO Task when uploading to Drive
entry.content:
Previous Upload to Drive flow:

- Copy/Move IO task.

- Sync to Drive.

- Call upload callback.



New Upload to Drive flow:

- Copy:

- Copy IO task.

- Sync to Drive.

- OnEndCopy:

- If the upload was successful and was supposed to be a Move:

- Delete the source file.

- If the upload was unsuccessful:

- Delete the destination file.

- Call upload callback.



Subscribe to Delete IO task updates to ensure the upload doesn't

complete until the delete has completed.



This change was introduced so a Cancel button can be added to the

progress notification for a Move to Drive upload. The source file is

deleted after the Move IO task completes. So now if the user clicks the

Cancel button during the sync phase, there is no need to awkwardly

restore back the source file.



Bug: b/244396230

Change-Id: Ia6f4263e9cd826a3f7ab4a1c694f9d65621e687a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680762

Reviewed-by: Peter Marshall

entry.title: Early return in ResourceScheduler::Client::OnVisibilityChanged()
entry.content:
Before this CL the method had `CHECK_NE(visible, visible_)`. This

check could fail if ResourceScheduler::OnVisibilityChanged(true) was

called at the startup, since the default value of `visible_` is true.

This CL removes the CHECK and do early return when visibility has not

changed.



We could consider changing the default value of `visible_` to false,

but it doesn't work for clients other than renderers (e.g. browser initiated requests).



Bug: 1457817

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: wait for and produce |CAPTURE_queue_| decoded pics
entry.content:
This CL implements the (blocking) waiting for decoded pictures on

|CAPTURE_queue_|, extracting those decoded pictures, producing the

associated VideoFrames and recycling them when available. It

essentially completes the decoding part, albeit there might be

circumstances where the logic stalls.



Since the wait is blocking, it happens in a SequencedTaskRunner we

get from a pool. A convenience RearmCAPTUREQueueMonitoring() method

does the hop to WaitOnceForCAPTUREQueueEvent() with a callback to

TryAndDequeueCAPTUREQueueBuffers() when the event happens. Note that

the "wait" happens only once and is re-armed from the main thread,

which simplifies lifetime reasoning.



Only weird thing really is the specific VideoFrame handling needed

for V4L2_MEMORY_MMAP CAPTURE queue (i.e. MTK8173 Hana), where

there's some manual lifetime mgmt needed :-(



A new DecodeAndOutputAllFrames test case is added for verification,

and it passes on MT8173 Hana and QC7180 trogdor. Anecdotally, while

decoding, most queues are almost empty/full (encoded chunks/decoded

frames, respectively), pointing to the current queue mgmt as more

performant than what ToT does.



Tested on hana and trogdor via:

/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests

/usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.vp8

'--vmodule=*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=4'

--gtest_filter=*.DecodeAndOutputAllFrames

--enable-features=V4L2FlatStatefulVideoDecoder



(this decodes all frames but skips the Flush at the end because the

end-of-stream logic is not implemented).



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: Id6f1a2ed99b8662670372964a35b9b9b3cac4c22

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4676285

Reviewed-by: Hang Nguyen

Reviewed-by: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Add dedicated LCP for eligible page loads
entry.content:
This CL adds new UMA

(NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2.RaceNetworkRequestEligible) that

records LCP only when the ServiceWorker script is "eligible" for the

feature.



"eligible" doesn't mean that the feature is enabled. The feature is only

enabled when the user belongs to the experiment group, and SW script

hash matches the allowlist, which is passed as a feature param.



We'll have an analysis in counterfactual way: Collect the metrics for

both experiment/control groups with a bias of eligibility. Eligibility

and experiment groups are independent. This feature first checks the

eligibility (whether SW script hash matches our list of samples) and

then checks the feature is enabled.



This is achieved by adding a new enum to

ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerBypassOption, which is

`kRaceNetworkRequestHoldback`. This means the page load is eligible for

the feature, but actually RaceNetworkRequest is not dispatched.



This CL plumbs ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerBypassOption and provide the

info as one of a loading behavior, in order to let

ServiceWorkerPageLoadMetricsObserver know if the page load is eligible

for the RaceNetworkRequest.

This reverts commit bbde40d0488d1933e20357fbd8fcee9cb3eaad5a.



Reason for revert: The flakiness in this test was almost certainly

caused by https://crbug.com/1344573, which caused random flake

in every test with a message loop that used a ScopedFeatureList.

and we shouldn't be leaving a random subset of tests that used

entry.content:
NGPhysicalBoxFragment::RareData was wasteful because we had to

allocate the whole RareData instance even if only one field was

necessary.



This CL makes non-GCed fields of RareData class storable in a Vector.

Also, this moves the RareData class to its own source files.



This CL should have no user-visible behavior changes.

entry.title: Reduce flickering from unstable punctuation and capitalization
entry.content:
This CL reduces flickering of the caption text when Live Translate is

enabled by caching untranslated text without punctuation or

capitalization. This change makes the Live Translate look for identical

phrases with alternate punctuation or capitalization and if found, use

the previous variant. This helps reduce flicker caused by an unstable

comma or question mark that can continue to flicker even though multiple

new sentences have been added since those words were spoken.



Bug: 1426899

Change-Id: If00c1e8aff8faaffc5e903a51b9b133e1fd41869

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4692202

Reviewed-by: Frank Liberato

Commit-Queue: Evan Liu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171563}

entry.title: Added ScopedPause to suppress nudges and toasts
entry.content:
This CL added ScopedAnchoredNudgePause and ScopedToastPause to suppress

anchored nudges and toasts. It will prevent all the nudges or toasts

from showing up during its lifetime. If paused, all the nudges or toasts

that are currently showing will disappear immediately. If a nudge or a

toast is dismissed, they won't be shown again since they are triggered

by user interactions in time.



Bug: b:271480256, b:278096844

Change-Id: Ie393b8374e0084350311dd66ea8e276248be5725

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4674673

entry.title: Revert "Disable flakily crashing network test"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 415a6be6381f56de652e8288198673ac8eb23ca8.



Reason for revert: The flakiness in this test was almost certainly

caused by https://crbug.com/1344573, which caused random flake

in every test with a message loop that used a ScopedFeatureList.



The underlying issue has been fixed (or at least worked around),

and we shouldn't be leaving a random subset of tests that used

ScopedFeatureList disabled due to it.

entry.title: Remove error handling in ParseExtensionPrinterSettings()
entry.content:
ParseExtensionPrinterSettings() receives its input dictionary from Print

Preview TS code, which is trusted code. As such, there is no need to

handle failures, as the trusted TS code should always generate valid

input.

entry.title: Replace Prerender2Holdback with PrerenderDSEHoldback + PreloadingConfig
entry.content:
This removes Prerender2Holdback, and introduces PrerenderDSEHoldback.

Holdback tests which previously relied on Prerender2Holdback now rely on

either PreloadingConfig or PrerenderDSEHoldback. (Note that DevTools

already is aware of PreloadingConfig, and it doesn't need to be aware of

PrerenderDSEHoldback, so some holdback-related code and tests are just

removed from the DevTools part of the codebase.)



See the linked bug for the motivation.



Bug: 1464173

entry.content:
This allows code in //chrome (e.g., for DSE) to override the holdback

status. In this CL, it is always left as kUnspecified (except in the new

tests). In future CLs, we will set it to kHoldback, when the new DSE

holdback feature is enabled.

entry.title: Mark DrawingBuffer's destruction_in_progress_ earlier.
entry.content:
Prior to the fix for Issue 1441633, DrawingBuffer::BeginDestruction

marked destruction_in_progress_ earlier, but still cleaned up the

allocated SharedImages for its ColorBuffers. It seems that

WebGLRenderingContext's destructor has become more expensive possibly

due to additional cleanup work for in-flight ColorBuffers, so restore

the old behavior, while still cleaning up the SharedImages associated

with these ColorBuffers.



Covered by the existing automated test for Issue 1441633.

entry.title: Support forwarding `--v=N` flag to device in adb_command_line.py
entry.content:
To enable verbose logging in Chromium, one can pass the arguments

`--enable-logging --v=3` (or some value other than 3). However on

Android, the adb_command_line.py script is interpreting `--v=3` as being

supplied to the script itself, rather than forwarding the argument to the device. This is caused by these calls:



```

// This includes a -v/--verbose flag

logging_common.AddLoggingArguments(parser)



// Attempts to interpret --v=3 as a logging argument

args, remote_args = parser.parse_known_args()

```



This change adds support for the "--" separator to explicitly distinguish

arguments which should be forwarded to the device.



Before this change:



```

// command fails

$ ./build/android/adb_chrome_public_command_line --enable-logging --v=3

usage: adb_command_line.py --name FILENAME [--device SERIAL] [flags...]



No flags: Prints existing command-line file.

Empty string: Deletes command-line file.

Otherwise: Writes command-line file.

adb_command_line.py: error: argument -v/--verbose: ignored explicit argument '3'

```



After this change:



```

$ ./build/android/adb_chrome_public_command_line -- --enable-logging --v=3

W 12:00:30.714 0.123s update_flags(XXXXXXXXXXXXXX) Your device (XXXXXXXXXXXXXX) is a user build; Chrome may or may not pick up your commandline flags. Check your "command_line_on_non_rooted_enabled" preference, or switch devices.

Wrote command line file. Current flags (in chrome-command-line):

XXXXXXXXXXXXXX (oriole-user 13 XXXX.XXXXXX.XXX XXXXXXX release-keys): --enable-logging --v=3

```



On device:



* Visit chrome://flags.

* Set "#enable-command-line-on-non-rooted-devices" to "Enabled".

* Restart Browser.

* Visit chrome://version.

* Observe the "Command Line:" starts with "_ --v=3 --enable-logging"



Change-Id: I91a41d13b47ab91b2286807c9208c4e592ec8159

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4691348

Reviewed-by: Benjamin Joyce (Ben)

Commit-Queue: Benjamin Joyce (Ben)

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171514}

entry.title: AW: fix test batching logic for WebView multiprocess
entry.content:
WebView tests may run in 2 possible modes: single process or

multiprocess (Refer to the @OnlyRunIn annotation). Switching process

mode requires restarting the browser process though, and tests which

used @Batch will default to not restarting. This bug meant that we were

running each test case twice, however both runs were actually the same

process mode (either both runs used an in-process renderer or both used

an out-of-process renderer). This was not immediately obvious because

the kWebViewSandboxedRenderer flag was being toggled correctly,

however the flag toggle had no effect because it's only read during a

process restart.



This change fixes the problem by enforcing that single-process and

multiprocess tests will never share a batch. Even though this does not

change how many test cases we actually run, this fix the process mode

for 15% of test cases, effectively increasing our test coverage.



This will have a slight impact to webview_instrumentation_test_apk

runtime, because the number of batches increases from 29 to 55. This

doesn't change the number of tests though, so the total runtime will

only increase slightly.



Fixed: 1465680

Test: Manually verify single & multiprocess tests get different batches

Test: run_webview_instrumentation_test_apk

Change-Id: Id5748f880b6db168a43dd7adac94df3c293b262d

entry.title: [Service Workers] Allow fetches from workers to use auto-picked certs
entry.content:
Certain requests may require client certs to proceed. The default

behavior for this is to show the user a certificate picker, from which

they can select one. There is also an enterprise policy to allow for

auto-selecting certificates for different URLs.



We only want to show the certificate picker to the user if the request

is made by a web page (something that has a corresponding WebContents);

otherwise, the UI is alarming and confusing. Because of this, we

auto-cancel any client cert selection for requestors that don't have a

WebContents. However, this means that requests from service workers

will never succeed, even if the certificate for the request would have

been auto-selected by policy.



Fix this by instead allowing requests from service workers to check if

there is an auto-selected certificate, and using that if so. Otherwise,

we continue with the old flow of requiring a WebContents to select a

certificate.



Add an end-to-end browser test for the same.
